channel.title: Java IDE's that don't require a dickload of memory
channel.description: Title says it all. Anyone know of a good IDE that doesn't use all of my memory? I'm having a horrid time with eclipse, so I'm looking for a new one

item.title: Java IDE's that don't require a dickload of memory
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

I completely get where you’re coming from. Every Java IDE I’ve used sucks cock, except one - http://www.jcreator.com/index.htm It was made in some .NET language and is very fast. I totally recommend.

Read full topic

[quote=“Jmood, post:25, topic:449702”]If you don’t have 2+ gbs of ram in 2012 then you’re doing it all wrong…

As suggested already vim and netbeans are both great.[/quote]

I can’t find a job to get the money for a computer, I live near almost 20 stores and restaurants and they are all looking for 16 or older. I actually took Torchic’s advice (from run3-se3ver) and looked for a job, but to no prevail. I’m 14 btw.

My computer only has 448MB of memory; its from 2002. I have programmed in notepad++ because my computer is too slow to run any IDE for any language I wanted to program, well, besides ruby.[/quote]
netbeans is quite more lightweight than eclipse. have you tried it?

item.source: Java IDE's that don't require a dickload of memory

item.title: Java IDE's that don't require a dickload of memory
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“Omer_, post:1, topic:449729”][quote author=s1gma link=topic=552597.msg4049071#msg4049071 date=1342320618]
vim with java plugins
[/quote]
Yeah bud, but the thing is he asked for an IDE
Anyway, if you were going to use a TEXT EDITOR you should use emacs.[/quote]what is an IDE compared to a DE (hint TEXT EDITOR + plugins)? the simple fact that it’s integrated means little because vim or emacs both have the power to provide a high degree of integration with a toolchain anyway, assuming you’re willing to combine plugins for both general editing and for language specialisation.

[quote=“The Enforcer, post:14, topic:449702”][quote author=Omer_ link=topic=552597.msg4049317#msg4049317 date=1342349335]

are you on a machine from 1999 or something?

2012 - when using inferior programming languages and shitty software is still acceptable. But the game is about to change.

Stop using java. Use the superior C++ and the superior C++ IDE’s.

Oh look, it’s you again.
C++ is inferior, etc. etc., don’t feel like going into this again. C++ is shit.

std::herpes cout(operator& x**)
{
    ++x = (aids::vector push_back(hiv::cout << "penis"));
}

[/quote]

According to my analysis there’s a high chance that you’re retarded.[/quote]based on a burning disdain of C++? yeah, your ‘analysis’ will truly be accurate!

Read full topic

item.source: Java IDE's that don't require a dickload of memory

item.title: Java IDE's that don't require a dickload of memory
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“s1gma, post:9, topic:449702”][quote author=Uncalled link=topic=552597.msg4049073#msg4049073 date=1342320862]

[quote author=s1gma link=topic=552597.msg4049071#msg4049071 date=1342320618]
vim with java plugins
[/quote]if you do that;
make sure you use vim (vi improved).

Linux and some versions of UNIX symlink vi to vim. you can get code completion with eclim, or you can get vi functionality within Eclipse with viPlugin. the syntax highlighting is great with vim. vim has good support for writing little macros like running ant/maven builds.
[/quote]not all Linux distros alias/symlink vi as vim, i like to use vi to unfuck myself if i broke vim or lisping and paredit.vim fucks up so it’s difficult to remove some parentheses.[/quote]i could have phrased it better. i know fedora distros symlink vi to vim, if i remember correctly, i haven’t used fedora for quite some time.

Read full topic
item.source: Java IDE's that don't require a dickload of memory

item.title: Java IDE's that don't require a dickload of memory
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:5, topic:449702”][quote author=s1gma link=topic=552597.msg4049071#msg4049071 date=1342320618]
vim with java plugins
[/quote]if you do that;
make sure you use vim (vi improved).

Linux and some versions of UNIX symlink vi to vim. you can get code completion with eclim, or you can get vi functionality within Eclipse with viPlugin. the syntax highlighting is great with vim. vim has good support for writing little macros like running ant/maven builds.[/quote]not all Linux distros alias/symlink vi as vim, i like to use vi to unfuck myself if i broke vim or lisping and paredit.vim fucks up so it’s difficult to remove some parentheses.

Read full topic

item.title: Java IDE's that don't require a dickload of memory
item.dc:creator: @Siggi Siggi
item.description:
@Siggi wrote:

I tried NetBeans once, but then after a while I just hated IDEs.

I use NetBeans when I need to design a GUI, then copy the code it generates, and go back to my text editing in a plain text editor.

I wrote a program that can also auto tab your code, if that was what you were looking for. JavaTab

Read full topic

item.source: Java IDE's that don't require a dickload of memory

item.title: Java IDE's that don't require a dickload of memory
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“s1gma, post:4, topic:449702”]vim with java plugins[/quote]if you do that;
make sure you use vim (vi improved).

Linux and some versions of UNIX symlink vi to vim. you can get code completion with eclim, or you can get vi functionality within Eclipse with viPlugin. the syntax highlighting is great with vim. vim has good support for writing little macros like running ant/maven builds.

Read full topic
item.source: Java IDE's that don't require a dickload of memory
